Film clip: 1997_01-01 Katriena: Katriena Witbooi Petrus: Petrus Vaalbooi OS: Off screen Keywords: Katriena Witbooi (Ouma),Petrus Vaalbooi, Nama language, ǂHanasen, kinship, biography, interview assistance, Willem Claasen, Elsie Vaalbooi, Petsi (place name).

cell.speaker: Petrus
cell.eng: OS (Petrus): Grandmother do you know Mother? Describe
her to him so that he … can understand well. He will not understand well.

cell.speaker: Petrus
cell.afr: Ken Ouma vir Ma? Verduidelik hom lat hy net ... mooi kan hoor. Hy sal nie mooi verstaan nie.

cell.speaker: Katriena
cell.eng: Katriena: I know her from the time she had Jacoba …

cell.speaker: Katriena
cell.afr: Ek ken hom van die tyd wat hy Jacoba gehad het

cell.speaker: Katriena
cell.eng: Katriena: I’ve known her since she was dating/married to Toper. While I was in […] they lived in Petsi, and when I started dating Willem Claasen from Petsi I relocated and moved there, that’s how I knew her, Elsie your mother.

cell.speaker: Katriena
cell.nam: Toperas ge ūhâ I ||aeba xu ta ǂan, ge ǂan. […] ta hâ tita hîas ge ||în ge Petsis ai hâ i sa, tsî Petsisa xu i ta ge Willem Klaaseba u tsîta ge tita ge ||naǀî doe, ||napa u ta ge ǂan. Elsisa, sa ma sa.

cell.notes: Khoekhoegowab, Niklaas transcribed and translated.

cell.speaker: Petrus
cell.eng: Grandmother’s, Grandmother, Grandmother … was Grandmother … who, who is Grandmother? Grandmother’s

cell.speaker: Petrus
cell.afr: Aha. Ouma se, Ouma, Ouma ... was Ouma …wie, wie’s Ouma? Ouma se naam?

cell.speaker: Subject
cell.eng: Subject: The Language Rosedale, Upington, A. Kassie, G. Seekooi

AFRIKAANS/KHOEKHOEGOWAB/N|UU TRANSCRIPTION
Khoekhoegowab, Niklaas transcribed and translated. Referring to male person. Female would be ‘Matis’

cell.speaker: Katriena
cell.eng: Katriena: Witbooi, the surname I was born with. My Father’s home-surname (diminutive) is Witbooi.

cell.speaker: Katriena
cell.afr: Witbooi, geboorte van. My Pa se huisievan is Witbooi.

cell.speaker: Katriena
cell.eng: Katriena: My Mother, my Father is … Lena Witbooi and my Father is Hendrik Witbooi and I am Kartriena Witbooi.

cell.speaker: Katriena
cell.afr: My Ma en my Pa is … Lena Witbooi en my Pa is Hendrik Witbooi en ek is Katriena Witbooi.

cell.notes: Pronounced Hansen but could be referring to the

AFRIKAANS/KHOEKHOEGOWAB/N|UU TRANSCRIPTION
family name ǂHanasen

cell.speaker: Petrus
cell.eng: OS (Petrus): There it is! That’s how I want it.

cell.speaker: Petrus
cell.afr: Daarsy! Dis soos ek hom wil hê.

cell.speaker: Petrus
cell.eng: OS (Petrus): Now what must I say for Mother? Grandmother must really say something? How should I do it?

cell.speaker: Petrus
cell.afr: Nou hoe moet ek vir Ma loop sê? Ouma moet darem iets sê? Hoe moet ek maak?

cell.speaker: Katriena
cell.eng: Katriena: Speak like that for Mother?

cell.speaker: Petrus
cell.eng: OS (Petrus): Yes look, Mother, Mother speaks the thing that Grandmother (speaks) well. Now help Mother. Now you (plural) must help Mother.
Now, Grandmother how do you feel about standing alongside Mother? I still have to come back and recall the names and recall the people.

cell.speaker: Petrus
cell.afr: Ja kyk, Ma, Ma praat die ding wat Ouma-goed (praat). Nou vir Ma help. Nou moet julle vir Ma help. Nou hoe voel Ouma om vir Ma by te staan? Ek moet nog terugkom en die namekom vat, en die koppe kom vat.

cell.notes: Petrus is asking Katriena for assistance in an upcoming interview. He is asking how she feels about serving in a supportive capacity during the interview by using their language (N|uu or Nama) with Mother. He wants their help to backtrack and recall more names and identify more people.

cell.eng: Subject: The Language Rosedale, Upington, A. Kassie, G. Seekooi

AFRIKAANS/KHOEKHOEGOWAB/N|UU TRANSCRIPTION

cell.speaker: Katriena
cell.eng: Katriena: I cannot say that I will stand alongside her
because I don’t know how long

cell.speaker: Katriena
cell.afr: Ek kan nie sê ek sal hom by staan nie want ek weet

cell.notes: Khoekhoegowab, Niklaas transcribed and translated.

cell.speaker: Petrus
cell.eng: OS (Petrus): That’s it, that is truly the thing.

cell.speaker: Petrus
cell.afr: Dis hy, dis eintlik die ding.

cell.speaker: Katriena
cell.eng: Katriena: God will keep me alive. I don’t know.

cell.speaker: Katriena
cell.nam: Elob xa ni sâu-e ǃkhai-e ta |u.

cell.notes: Khoekhoegowab, Niklaas transcribed and translated.

cell.speaker: Petrus
cell.eng: OS (Petrus): No, now those are Mother’s fears.

cell.speaker: Petrus
cell.afr: Aa, nou dis Ma se vrese.

cell.speaker: Petrus
cell.eng: OS (Petrus): And Grandmother can maybe still say that little bit.

cell.speaker: Petrus
cell.afr: En Ouma kan nog miskien daai bietjie gee.

cell.speaker: Petrus
cell.eng: OS (Petrus): That little bit of language and to tell them how to do it – the people.

cell.speaker: Petrus
cell.afr: Daai bietjie taal en vir hulle sê hoe moet hulle maak – die mense.

cell.speaker: Katriena
cell.eng: Katriena: Thus, let them who are alive take the land, those

cell.eng: Subject: The Language Rosedale, Upington, A. Kassie, G. Seekooi

AFRIKAANS/KHOEKHOEGOWAB/N|UU TRANSCRIPTION

cell.eng: who will live longer, children. Let me be strong to help the children.

cell.nam: ûitsama se nî sâu-e nâ, |gôana. Īs |gaima tsî hui |gôana.

cell.speaker: Katriena
cell.eng: Katriena: That is all that I want to say.

cell.speaker: Katriena
cell.afr: Dis al wat ek will sê.
